question: As per World Health Organisation, which of the following diseases is the leading cause of infant deaths in India?
explanation: Pneumonia is a lung infection. It is generally caused by microorganisms (airborne infections). But there are several non-infectious causes- through aspiration of food and milk, foreign body, drugs, hypersensitivity reaction etc. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), one in three deaths in India is caused by pneumonia. Pneumonia in India is the leading cause of infant deaths. Every year almost 2 lakh children under five die of pneumonia in India.
